doc:
C. Aubrey Smith https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C._Aubrey_Smith 0 Sir Charles Aubrey Smith, CBE (21 July 1863 – 20 December 1948) was an England Test cricketer who became a stage and film actor, acquiring a niche as the officer-and-gentleman type, as in the first sound version of The Prisoner of Zenda (1937). In Hollywood, he organised British actors into a cricket team, much intriguing local spectators. Sir_Charles_Aubrey_Smith , CBE ( 21 July_1863 – 20_December_1948 ) was an_England_Test_cricketer who became a_stage_and_film_actor , acquiring a_niche as the_officer-and-gentleman_type , as in the_first_sound_version of The_Prisoner of Zenda ( 1937 ) . In Hollywood , he organised British_actors into a_cricket_team , much_intriguing_local_spectators .
